skill.name: devflow
skill.description: End-to-end agent development process. Use when coordinating work, dispatching agents, or reviewing PRs.
skill.summary: End-to-end agent development process. Use when coordinating work, dispatching agents, or reviewing P...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only development workflow guidelines in markdown format. All 42 static findings are false positives: markdown code block delimiters (backticks) were misidentified as Ruby/shell command execution; workflow terminology like 'dispatch' and 'coordinate' triggered C2 false positives; git/github CLI command references triggered system reconnaissance false positives; and JSON metadata fields triggered cryptographic hash false positives. The skill contains no executable code, network calls, or file system access. The pre-computed skill-report.json already passed security audit with safe rating.

content.value_statement: Development teams struggle with coordinating AI agents and ensuring complete issue coverage across complex projects. This skill provides a systematic 5-phase workflow that guarantees 100% requirement implementation through mandatory coverage verification at every step.
actual_capabilities: Defines 5-phase development workflow from assessment to merge
Enforces 100% issue requirement coverage verification at every phase
Coordinates parallel agent implementation with Docker-based dispatch
Implements 6-pass code review starting with mandatory coverage check
Integrates with GitHub CLI for issue and PR management
Requires Mermaid diagrams for documenting architectural changes
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI for full functionality with issues and PRs
Assumes Docker environment for agent dispatch capability
Designed for Git-based workflows only, limited for other VCS
May be overly rigid for small or quick changes

use_cases.title: Coordinate Multi-Agent Projects
use_cases.description: Manage complex development tasks by dispatching multiple AI agents in parallel while ensuring complete requirement coverage across all workstreams

use_cases.title: Systematic PR Review Process
use_cases.description: Follow a structured 6-pass review process that starts with verifying 100% issue coverage before checking code quality or merging

use_cases.title: Ensure Complete Feature Delivery
use_cases.description: Track development progress with mandatory coverage gates that prevent merging until every requirement from the original issue is implemented

prompt_templates.title: Start Development Workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: Begin coordinated development on a new issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Use devflow to assess issue #123 and coordinate multi-agent development for implementing the user authentication feature

prompt_templates.title: Review PR with Coverage
prompt_templates.scenario: Review pull request with requirement verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply devflow Phase 3 review to PR #456, starting with 100% issue coverage verification before code quality checks

prompt_templates.title: Final Coverage Gate
prompt_templates.prompt: Run devflow Phase 4.5 final coverage gate on PR #789 to ensure all requirements from issue #321 are implemented before merge

prompt_templates.title: Complex Architecture Change
prompt_templates.prompt: Follow devflow for implementing the new microservices architecture and include Mermaid sequence diagrams in the PR for all state flows

output_examples.input: Use devflow to coordinate implementing a new payment processing feature across multiple agents
output: Phase 1: Extracted 8 requirements from issue #234 including PCI compliance, webhook handling, and error recovery mechanisms
Phase 2: Dispatched 3 agents in parallel - payment gateway integration, webhook processing, and error handling each in Docker containers
Phase 3: Completed 6-pass review with 100% coverage verification - all 8 requirements addressed before quality checks
Phase 4.5: Final coverage gate passed - all requirements verified in payment/gateway.rs:45-89, webhooks/handler.rs:23-67, errors/recovery.rs:12-34
Phase 5: Merged PR #567 with Closes #234 - issue automatically closed, all CI checks passed

output_examples.input: Apply devflow to review PR #890 that implements database migration changes
output: Phase 3 Review initiated - Pass 0.5 coverage check running first
Extracted 5 requirements from issue #888, verified 5 implemented in PR #890 - 100% coverage confirmed
Pass 1-5 completed: compile success, no dead code, proper abstractions, environment compatible, verification commands ready
Mermaid flowchart included showing before/after database schema transitions
Phase 4.5: Line-by-line verification complete, ready for human approval and merge

best_practices: Always start with Phase 1 Oracle Assessment to extract ALL requirements before any implementation begins
Use the 6-pass review process consistently, never skip the mandatory coverage verification pass 0.5
Include Mermaid diagrams in PRs when implementing flows, states, or any architectural changes
anti_patterns: Never merge PRs without first passing 100% issue coverage verification at Phase 4.5
Do not push directly to branches - always use feature branches with proper PR workflow
Avoid manual issue closing - use Closes #X syntax in PR body for automatic closure on merge

faq.question: Is devflow compatible with non-GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: Devflow is optimized for GitHub with CLI integration but can be adapted for other Git platforms with modified commands

faq.question: What happens if coverage verification fails?
faq.answer: The workflow returns to Phase 2 with a detailed gap list - merging is blocked until 100% coverage is achieved

faq.question: How does devflow integrate with existing CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Devflow works alongside CI/CD - Phase 3 review begins after CI passes but adds mandatory coverage verification before merge

faq.question: Is the 100% coverage requirement too strict for agile development?
faq.answer: The requirement ensures complete delivery - teams can split large issues into smaller tasks to maintain agility

faq.question: Can I use devflow for solo development without agents?
faq.answer: Yes, skip agent dispatch in Phase 2 and use devflow as a structured development and review checklist

faq.question: How does the Docker agent dispatch work?
faq.answer: Phase 2 uses Docker containers to run independent Claude agents in parallel, each working on assigned task subsets
